p: Several studies have focused on projections of how the infections are likely to spread based on statistical analyses. Neher etÂ al. [23] have proposed a seasonal transmissability model based on SIR [24], a class of mathematical epidemiological models to predict the trajectory of the virus re-infecting sub-populations in the world in future years. They have taken into account the infection, emigration, and population turnover rates respectively as part of their proposed model. A refined version of their model [25] considers visualizing the projected hospital resources necessary in order to support a pandemic like COVID-19.
